ygData.subject: RE: Dual Bard Invisibility Question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Was my invis in time with yours?  If they were at different times, maybe the mob was seeing through mine (mine overwrote yours), then indifferent (when
ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [SMTP:kim@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, January 05, 2000 4:39 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Dual Bard Invisibility Question
>
> On Wed, 5 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> > That would seem to indicate you could not stand in front of any
> aggressive
> > mob while playing invis. When the song visibly pulsed he would attack
> you.
> > Since this does not happen, I have one theory why not which explains
> another
>
> The mob didn't attack us because it was busy fighting the
> people who started the train.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
Was my invis in time with yours? If they were at different times,
maybe the mob was seeing through mine (mine overwrote yours), then
indifferent (when yours overwrote mine)

Otherwise it's just the fact that ANY song was being played,
affecting the party (since your invis was on first)

Just some thoughts...

Bien
